page.title: 09FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (4).
page.content: {Sheep.} When we went to visit the farms we found that thirteen farmers kept sheep in the area that we surveyed and four farmers had no sheep at all . The different kinds of sheep we found are Devon Longwool, Poll Dorset, Dorset Horn, Dorset Cross and Suffolk. Most farms had a mixture of these breeds.The total number of sheep kept in the area amounted to 3,416. {Lambing.} The time of lambing varies from farm to farm. Some farms have lambs in December and March and some have lambing all the year round. The total amount of wool collected during the year was 6,704 kg,s. Adding all the farmer's lambs together the total number of lambs born in 1984/1985 was 4,724.
